DOC.HEAD: Star, Times Set March 1 as Merger Date
DOC.TEXT: The merger of the Kansas City Star and the Kansas City Times will take place March 1, the editor of the newspapers said Thursday. Joe McGuff, editor and vice president, said March 1 was a good date because it was the start of a billing cycle. Plans to merge the morning Times and the afternoon Star were announced Oct. 5. McGuff said the decision came about because of sagging demand for afternoon papers and changing lifestyles. The newspaper, to be called the Kansas City Star, will publish in the morning. McGuff said it would be larger and better organized than the current morning newspaper. He said it would try to appeal to readers who wish to linger over in-depth articles and those who prefer to scan for facts.
